course.subject: PHYS
course.name: Contemporary Applications of Physics: Quantum Information Technology
course.description: Students in this course will apply the basic concepts of quantum mechanics to the topic of quantum information technology. The course will briefly introduce the foundations of quantum information science and discuss recent developments in realizing useful quantum devices for quantum communication, quantum computing and quantum simulation.
course.prerequisites: PHYS 3036 OR PHYS 3037 OR CHEM 3420

reviews.author: _NattU_
reviews.comment_content:
This is a one-month long course, much like its two counterparts. There are 8 lectures and 2 tutorials in total. The tutorials are meant to help you install Qiskit plus Q&A for any questions you might have regarding the program. We also had a guest lecturer who covered two of the lectures on Qiskit.

The course content are as follows:

1) Quantum Computation I
2) Quantum Computation II
3) Entanglement I
4) Entanglement II
5) Quantum technology I
6) (Guest) Qiskit I
7) Quantum technology II
8) (Guest) Qiskit II
reviews.comment_teaching: He's a decent lecturer and a nice guy. Easy to talk to and has a friendly tone.
reviews.comment_grading:
We only had one Term paper worth 100% due at the end of the semester. Prof also gave out an additional Qiskit assignment which could count for up to 20% bonus.

Term paper details:
- Roughly 800 words (excluding reference)
- Covering anything relevant related to Quantum Information/Computing (or smth from the lectures)
- Intended for general scientists
- Evaluated on:
1) Academic correctness ( 30 pts)
2) Complete literature review (30 pts)
3) Citations (10 pts)
4) Creative writing (10pts)
5) Scientific writing (20 pts)

Any accounts of plagiarism will result in an F grade.

At the beginning of the course, Prof. Jo said he'll give everyone an A range as long we hand in proper writing. I got A-  for scoring 88/100 on my term paper (the mean was 89) and I didn't do the bonus homework.
reviews.comment_workload: You'll need to struggle a bit towards the end of the sem because it takes a lot of effort to cover literature review to understand the topics in-depth. Problem is, the schedule overlaps with your midterms/ finals so it might be a hassle down the road. Other than that, you can just enjoy your time during lectures.
